body.name: Smart Choice Granite Countertop Dishwasher Installation Kit
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 11 hrs 6 mins
features: Approved for granite, quartz, acrylic, and other solid surface counter tops
Easy install no glue, no drill, and no mess
body.description: Granite Countertop Dishwasher Installation Kit facilitates the installation of an undercounter dishwasher without the need to drill holes for mounting screws. It is approved for granite, quartz, acrylic and other solid surface countertops. Kit comes with 2 dishwasher brackets and hardware.Installation Instructions1. Fully clean the mounting area on the underside of the countertop using an alcohol-based solution. 2. Open the dishwasher door to expose the dishwasher mounting brackets.3. Install the adhesive tabs supplied in the kit using the supplied set screw to each of the dishwasher mounting brackets.4. Once installed to the dishwasher, peel back a corner of the red protective liner to make for easier removal once underneath the countertop. 5. With the adhesive tabs installed, position the dishwasher underneath the countertop to the correct depth, and left to right adjustment. Once the dishwasher is in position, completely remove the red liner.6. Firmly hand press the adhesive tabs to the countertop and hold for a 30 second count. Then with a clamping aid, clamp the adhesive tabs in place for 5 minutes. Once 5 minutes has elapsed, the bond is set and will cure to its permanent bond in one hour.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, works great on granite countertop
reviews.reviewText: The idiots I bought my house from (low-cost flipper dippers) did not secure the dishwasher correctly. I have granite countertops, and instead of securing the sides to the wood cabinets, the flipper dipper morons laid a bunch of silicone caulk on the underside of the granite and "screwed" the top bracket into that. Who'd have thunk that anyone was that stupid? Lo and behold, 3 years later, my dishwasher "fell out" of the spot it was in because constant use essentially "vibrated" the screws out of the caulk. As I didn't have the side-brackets, and was at a loss of how to secure the dishwasher in its spot, I found this granite countertop kit -- best solution I've researched. After stripping the underside of caulk, and cleaning the granite with acetone, then alcohol, and waiting for it to dry, I affixed the original under-cabinet brackets to the top of the dishwasher and use this kit per the instructions and * voila *, problem solved. So far, great solution - 5 stars for now. I do have a WARNING for anyone who buys this - make sure you line up everything correctly and be very patient when moving the dishwasher into position BEFORE applying the adhesive side to the countertop. I was impatient and my installation is crooked. Otherwise, an elegant solution to a simple problem.19Jun21: One of the mounts had its adhesive fail and it fell off. It’s on the rough underside of granite, and I thought it was supposed to bond. It didn’t. Oh well. Have to find another solution. 🤷🏽‍♂️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Secured my Dishwasher
reviews.reviewText: This was a fix that any installer should have carried on his truck. Otherwise, its not installed. Quick and easy. Bonds within an hour. No more slip and slide. Use with a magnetic screw driver as the screws included are tiny.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars They work great
reviews.reviewText: I have used these on several dishwashers over the last 5 years. Just make sure you clean the underside of the stone and clamp them in place for about 30 mins. If you just press them with your hands they will fall off and may not be able to be reused

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install
reviews.reviewText: Like the product and a necessary purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Worked well for about 6 months
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install and worked as expected. The tape started to loosen after 6 months. Someone said on here he removed his double-sided tape and used epoxy instead. This should work

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE - FAIL! BEWARE
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE - Not even two months since installing this product and one of the mounts has come loose and the metal bracket damaged the dishwasher door when it was opened. Now I have to find another way to fasten my dishwasher to granite, plus I have to figure out what parts to replace on the door. I spent hard-earned money on this adhesive kit, but have found it to be WORTHLESS! Please save your money and avoid this product. I fell for it, but you don't have to! [Updated update - The top part of the dishwasher door cost $78. Would be much more if I didn't do it myself.]Original - review: After having our granite countertops recently installed I realized that no one had mentioned reattaching the dishwasher mounting screws. I thought about trying to find small masonry screws and drilling holes, but I happened to see this product at Lowes. I ordered it from Amazon because I thought it might be cheaper than the $12.99 price at Lowes...it wasn't. Anyway, it appears to have worked. The instructions say to clamp it for only 5 minutes, but I used my own clamps and small pieces of wood and left it clamped for about an hour before removing. One thing to keep in mind is that the included screws are very small and if they fell while trying to install, finding them in the bottom of the dishwasher would be extremely difficult, so I spread out a beach towel from the upper dishwasher tray down across the open door, so that any dropped screws would be caught and not lost forever. Of course after doing that I didn't drop either of them, but it was quick and easy insurance. It looks good so far and seems to be holding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as Described
reviews.reviewText: Just had a new stone countertop installed and neglected to have the installer drill holes for the dishwasher brackets. I installed these and it did the trick. Closes solidly. No movement. This is the 2nd dishwasher I've used them on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Universal for any dishwasher!
reviews.reviewText: So glad I bought for Amazon and not from Best Buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stays in place, stops dishwasher tipping forward
reviews.reviewText: Adheres well to my granite counter and prevents my dishwasher from tipping forward.Tip: wipe down installation with rubbing alcohol to clean it. Then install it nd use wood clamp to hold it with pressure overnight to ensure best adhesion. Then mount your dishwasher to it after .Did this and had no issues with the adhesive detaching.

Replaced my old dishwasher and installed the new Bosch one ourselves- I bought this just in case we needed it and I’m so glad I did! The previous setup was with a copper pipe but the new dishwasher hookup was in a different location and would have been difficult to adjust the copper pipe - the flexible hose was perfect for the job!

Good quality product that was very easy to install. Glue is strong and will keep the item in place. Screws have a flat top to prevent scratching the dishwasher door. Well thought out and my dishwasher is firmly in place whenever I open the door.
